page.title: 11Places to play in Spennells.
page.content: On the 1974 map we were given, Spennells is shown as "the Bogs". There were no houses then. All our class of 9 year-olds play by the stream and in Bluebell Wood. People jog and walk dogs there. When the Worcestershire Conservation Society takes over the wood and marsh, our school will help them. All the roads are dead-ends and are named after birds. We use the alley ways between the roads to get around on our bikes. It takes longer by car. We have dens our mums don't know about by the building-sites. There are three play areas, two recreation fields, a BMX track, but only one Portakabin shop. We go to Captain's Pool to feed the ducks. The wild geese there wake us up when they fly over.
